description.narrative: The Program Development Objective is to increase access to and improve quality of school education, particularly basic education (Grades 1-8), especially for children from marginalized groups.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :FA, Sched. 2, Section I, Para B 1 | Description :The Recipient shall cause MOE/DOE, not later than April 15 ofeach year, toprepare and furnish to the Association a draft ASIP and AWPB for the followingFiscal Year, for its review, andpromptly f | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :FA, Sched. 2, Section I, Para B 2 | Description :Submit an annual report, two weeks prior to JRM, summarizingthe status of key indicators, relevant surveys,special studies and education project expenditure reviews. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :FA, Sched. 2, Section I, Para C 1 | Description :Provide each Subproject Grant to a Beneficiary, other than acommunity school, pursuant to an agreement to be entered into between the Recipient and such Beneficiary (Subproject GrantAgreement) conta | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :FA, Sched. 2, Section I, Para C 2 | Description :Provide Subproject Grant to a Beneficiary, which is a communityschool: (i)in accordance with the Program Implementation Guidelines; and (ii)pursuant to arrangements satisfactory to theAssociation. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :FA, Sched. 2, Section II, Para B 2 | Description :Prepare interim unauditedfinancial reports for the Projectcovering the Fiscal Year trimester, in form andsubstance satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :Yearly

target.value: (i) Targeted interventions implemented in 10 most disadvantaged districts (according to equity index), and (ii) 20% reduction inthe aggregate number of OOSC in these 10 districts

actual.value: A composite equity index is in place and targeted intervention to bring out-of-school children in the 10 most disadvantageddistricts is in progress.
